name: Garth Nettheim
biography: Garth Nettheim ('Terra Nullius') is Emeritus Professor of Law at the University of NSW. He is a member of the NSW State Reconcilation Committee and an elected member of the Research Advisory Committee of the Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies. An initial council member for the first Aboriginal Legal Service in Australia, he also established the Indigenous Law Centre at the University of NSW. His publications include 'Out Lawed: Queensland's Aboriginies and Islanders and the Rule of Law' (1973), 'Aboriginies, Human Rights and the Law' (1974), 'Victims of Law: Black Queenslanders Today' (1982), 'Indigenous Legal Issues: Commentary and Materials' (1997) and 'Aboriginies and Torres Strait Islanders' in 'The Laws of Australia' (since 1993).
